Title: SUPINE PELVIC TILTS
Directions: This is a motor control and patterning exercise that aims to give you individual control of your pelvis. The goal of this exercise is to learn how to tilt the pelvis back and forth without using your hips or upper back to compensate for the movement. Lie down on your back with your feet planted on the floor and knees bent to 90 degrees. You may place your hands on your pelvis to help visualize or assist this movement. Tilt the pelvis forwards to arch (extend) the lumbar spine without using your legs. Tilt the pelvis back wards to curl (flex) the lumbar spine.
